body.response:
The DC Individual Responsibility Requirement is a law in the District of Columbia that requires residents to have qualifying health coverage, obtain an exemption, or pay a tax penalty. According to the context provided from https://metrohealthlink.com/blog-single/dc-individual-responsibility-requirement, all DC residents must comply with this requirement.

The key points about the DC Individual Responsibility Requirement are:

- DC residents must have qualifying health insurance coverage, get an exemption, or pay a penalty when filing taxes.
- The penalty for not having coverage in 2024 is $795 per adult, $397.50 per child, up to a maximum of $2,385 per family or 2.5% of household income above the tax filing threshold.
- Exemptions from the requirement are available through Metro Health Link.
- There is an annual penalty cap of $4,388 per person in 2024, multiplied by up to 5 family members.

The context provides a comprehensive explanation of this DC law, including details on how the penalty is calculated, exemption information, and penalty caps. Let me know if you need any additional details from the provided information.

articles.title: DC's Individual Responsibility Requirement
articles.summary: Explanation of DC's health coverage law, including penalties for non-compliance, exemptions, and penalty caps.
key_points: DC law requires residents to have qualifying health coverage, get an exemption, or pay a penalty
Penalty for 2024 is $795 per adult, $397.50 per child, up to $2,385 per family or 2.5% of family income above tax filing threshold
Exemptions are available through Metro Health Link
Penalty cap for 2024 is $4,388/year per person, multiplied by up to 5 family members
